result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel A Rembert

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel A Rembert not in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Daniel A Rembert.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Daniel A Rembert appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Daniel A Rembert.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has completed almost all of the terms of the agreement, except for the completion of restitution. Court orders the removal of JusticePoint monitoring due to making successful completion of the terms of the agreement. Defendant is to make a payment of $400 a month towards restitution. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 8.25.22

Defendant Daniel A Rembert in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel A Rembert appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defendant made 6/8 office contacts. Apology letter and essay has been completed. Defendant needs to complete community serivce and make a minimum payment of $350.00 towards resitution. Case adjourned to Branch 21. 
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 7.8.2022
Received and Filed, DPA Letter of Apology
Per parties request, case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 21. New date selected via email with parties.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 4/19/22
Oral No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with John K.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 21, Judge Davis. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms or application for CCW license. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel A Rembert in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Initial Appearance. Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds remotely.   Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement; filed.
